info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 7 at 2:50PM EDT until April 8 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Peachtree City GA
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia...
Oconee River at Milledgeville affecting Wilkinson, Washington and Baldwin Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Oconee River at Milledgeville.
* WHEN...From this evening to Tuesday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 22 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding occurs upstream and downstream from the gage located around one half mile upstream from the Georgia Highway 22 and 24 bridge. Low lying portions of woodlands and pasture in the natural flood plain will begin to flood. This will include portions of the sidewalks in the Oconee River Greenway Park just downstream from the bridge. Sinclair Dam will have one to two gates open to reach this height.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM EDT Monday the stage was 14.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this evening to 24.8 feet Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday afternoon to 15.3 feet Wednesday evening. It will rise to 15.4 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 22 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TUESDAY EVENING

area.areaDesc: Baldwin, GA; Washington, GA; Wilkinson, GA
